think: Global Witness is an NGO focused on exposing and combating environmental and human rights abuses linked to resource exploitation. Their work revolves around advocating for accountability in the natural resource sector and protecting environmental and land defenders. Given their stated objectives and projects, they are primarily advocating for environmentalism and human rights rather than promoting fossil fuel interests.
explanation: Global Witness is an international non-profit organization that primarily focuses on addressing issues related to natural resource exploitation, corruption, and environmental and human rights abuses. They are involved in numerous campaigns aimed at reducing the impacts of industries such as oil, gas, and mining, making them a conservation or environmental group rather than a fossil fuel organization. Their mission is to hold companies and governments accountable for their environmental impacts, aligning with conservation efforts rather than profit-seeking in fossil fuels. More details can be found on their [official site](https://www.globalwitness.org/en/).

think: The National Grid is primarily engaged in the delivery of electricity and natural gas services. It operates in the energy sector, specifically focusing on transmission and distribution, which involves significant infrastructure related to fossil fuels. Despite their claims of working towards a cleaner energy future, the company is still fundamentally part of the energy delivery industry that includes fossil fuel use. Therefore, it falls under the broader category of a fossil fuel organization by virtue of its operational scope.
explanation: National Grid operates as a for-profit company involved in the transmission and distribution of electricity and natural gas. It serves more than 20 million customers in the Northeast of the United States, focusing on establishing a cleaner energy infrastructure while still relying on fossil fuels in its operations. Their vision includes eliminating fossil fuels, but they continue to deliver energy through both electric and gas systems that include fossil fuel resources. More details can be found on their official website: [National Grid](https://www.nationalgrid.com/us).
